question: Which former Indian Army chief has been awarded the United States (US) 'Legion of Merit'?
explanation: Former Indian Army chief General Dalbir Singh Suhag has been awarded the United States (US) \'Legion of Merit (Degree of commander)\' on August 17, 2018, at Pentagon, Washington DC. The award was given to Singh for exceptionally meritorious service as Chief of Army Staff (CoAS) from August 2014 to December 2016. With this, he became the 2nd Indian military officer to get this award after General Rajendrasinghji Jadeja in 1946. The Legion of Merit is awarded in four degrees - Degree of Chief Commander, Degree of commander, Degree of the officer, Degree of Legionnarie.
